input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command.
Specifes the target domain where you wish to restore the Group Policy Object. If no target domain is specified the default current domain will be used.
Restore the Domain Controller Policy or both the Domain Controller Policy and the Domain Group Policy Object Valid values: dc, both
Ignore the Active Directory schema version number? Valid values: true

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on Linux.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on SunOS.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">dcgpofix</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${ignore schema}') != 0 and '${ignore schema}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /ignoreschema</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${target domain}') != 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /target: ${target domain}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${policy}') != 0 and '${policy}' = 'dc'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> dc</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${policy}') != 0 and '${policy}' = 'both'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> both</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Perform Restore Default Domain Group Policy Restores the default Group Policy objects to their original state.
